availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
12
The Governor approved an account of $100 to Sanford Goin for two months service at State Arsenal as Armorer
He appointed J R. Lambreth Notary Public for Muhlenberg county until the end of the next session of the General Assembly
He respited for twelve months a Judgment of a Justice of the Peace for Bath county of $30. and fifteen days imprisonment against Andrew Ingram for a breach of the peace
He commissioned the officers of the Enrolled Militia for Clay County, duly elected
He approved the Constitution and By-Laws of the "Jackson Guards of the City of Louisville.
